artist: Engraver: Thomas Milton; Painter: After Paolo Veronese; Delineator: William Marshall Craig; Publisher: Longman, Hurst, Rees, Orme, and Brown London
description: Venus in a landscape with Adonis across her lap and a snake in her left hand; putti supporting head of Adonnis
inscription:
Signature, Title, Date and Inscription

In plate in black: [Class the second  VENUS LAMENTING THE DEATH OF ADONIS   Schools of Upper Italy/ 29/ P. Veronese   5.7 by 4.91/2 /Drawn by W.M. Craig_Engraved by T. Milton/ LONDON/ Published March 1st 1817 by Longman, Hurst, Ross, Orme & Brown; J. White; Cadell & Davies; a& P. W. Tomkins 54 New Bond Street]; below image in pencil: [1-204]
provenance: John Crosby, Minneapolis; given to MIA, 1947.
title: Venus Lamenting the Death of Adonis
